snippet: Fifty-five percent of voters said they would support a referendum on the November ballot to allow the development of up to seven full-scale casinos.
abstract: Siena College poll finds that majority of New York State voters say they will support November referendum to allow development of  up to seven full-scale casinos in the state; polling suggests, however, that wording of ballot, which presents only positive arguments for gambling, like job growth and lowered property taxes, affected results.
lead_paragraph: Fifty-five percent of voters said they would support a referendum on the November ballot to allow the development of up to seven full-scale casinos.

headline.main: Majority Back Referendum to Add Casinos, Poll Finds
headline.print_headline: Majority Back Referendum to Add Casinos, Poll Finds
